result.execSummary:
The defendant Adam J Becker was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid at $50.00 per month commencing 11/1/16 and each month thereafter or penalty of 7 days jail for non-payment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Defendant Adam J Becker in court with Attorney Nicholas Martinez.  Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State moves to amend Count #2 to county ordinance disorderly conduct.  Defendant enters a no contest plea to amended charge.  Court finds Defendant guilty of amended charge on Count #2 and imposes fine of $330.50 -to be paid at $50.00 per month, commencing 11/1/16, alternate 7 days jail if not paid.  Count #1 is dismissed and read-in.
